intro: Orthocarpus faucibarbatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive, hairy texture. It is typically found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
